summary: This document is a preparation memo for the trial testimony of Larry Visoski, Jeffrey Epstein's longtime chief pilot. It details his employment history, responsibilities, record-keeping practices, descriptions of Epstein's aircraft and properties, and his observations of Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and other passengers.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Longtime employee of Jeffrey Epstein from 1991 to 2019, first as captain and later as chief pilot. He is being prepared for trial testimony and provides detailed information about flight operations, record-keeping, and Epstein's properties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Visoski's employer from 1991 to 2019. The document details his aircraft, properties, travel patterns, and his relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as being on almost every flight from 1991 through the 2000s, initially appearing as an employee and later romantically involved with Epstein. She was an orchestrator of his properties and travel.

persons.name: Dave Rodgers
persons.context: Hired alongside Larry Visoski in 1991. He worked as a pilot for Epstein until 2000 when he was reportedly demoted because Epstein did not like his flying.

persons.name: Bill Hammond
persons.context: Hired by Larry Visoski after 2000 to be another pilot for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Itzhak Perlman
persons.context: A passenger Visoski recalls flying with Jeffrey Epstein to Traverse City, Michigan, related to visits to the Interlochen music camp.

connections.description: Visoski was employed by Epstein from 1991 to 2019, first as a captain/pilot and later as chief pilot, responsible for flight operations and record-keeping.
Visoski interacted with Maxwell frequently as she was involved in scheduling flights and managing properties. He visited her residences to assist with equipment.
Described as being together on almost every flight. Their relationship evolved from employer-employee to a romantic one, with Maxwell managing his properties and travel.
Both were hired together in 1991 and worked as pilots for Jeffrey Epstein until 2000.

events.title: Larry Visoski Hired by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Larry Visoski and Dave Rodgers were hired as pilots for Jeffrey Epstein in Columbus, Ohio, after an introduction arranged by the chief pilot of The Limited.

events.title: Role Change for Pilots
events.description: Larry Visoski and Dave Rodgers swapped roles, with Visoski becoming chief pilot, because Epstein did not like the way Rodgers landed the plane.

events.title: Records Turned Over to Attorney
events.description: Larry Visoski recalls turning over flight and passenger records from 1999 through 2006 to one of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Distances Herself
events.description: Larry Visoski noticed that Ghislaine Maxwell 'broke away' from Jeffrey Epstein and spent significantly less time flying with him.

keyFacts: Larry Visoski was Jeffrey Epstein's chief pilot from 1991 to 2019 and kept detailed passenger manifests and flight logs, which were periodically faxed to Epstein's personal assistant.
Ghislaine Maxwell was on 'almost every flight' from 1991 through the 2000s and was described as an orchestrator of Epstein's properties and travel.
Pilots could not observe passengers during flights as cockpit doors were always closed and interior compartment doors on the Boeing 727 were also shut.
Visoski turned over a significant number of flight records (1999-2006, and possibly earlier) to one of Epstein's attorneys around 2006.
The document describes the interiors and features of Epstein's multiple aircraft and his lavish properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, the US Virgin Islands, and Paris.
